Articles.Content:
Thanks to Sips for featuring this great game at Yogscast.

Played around with it for a few hours.

First accidental 'achievement' was having my command module left orbiting the sun on one of my first starts without a means to return.

Reaching orbit around the planet needed some practise.

Next goal is a reliable way to the moon using the standard parts only.

- mh
Welcome budy I\'ve just started playing to not having much luck lol moon my target at minute

Hi!

Welcome to the forums, and happy boosting!

Welcome to the KSP Forums!

Happy Launching!

Arrr!

Capt\'n Skunky

Welcome to the Kerbal Space Program Forum, mostly_harmless.

Let\'s hope you stay harmless! ;D

Welcome to the forums!

Have a donut.

Landed on the Mun with stock parts only.

Enough fuel to get back to Kerbal.

But while accelerating the timer to wait for a nice sunrise, the craft exploded suddenly. Looked like it was slowly sinking into the moon surface. Ah well.

Lets try again.

But I must say the Mun landing is a bit nerve wrecking. Especially without the RCS.

Well youve made it farther than i have XD

So far the toll is:

150 kerbians pronounced Deceased

2.9 Trillion dollars worth of equipment destroyed and or unrecoverable in the depths of space

3 successful.....Survivable landings

1 successful mun....visit...

Made it to the Mun. Again all stock parts, no RCS.

Got a bit of hilly terrain. But smooth touch down on Mun, with plenty of fuel to spare.

Lift off, finding a Kermal capture course and then text book splash down.

Can\'t wait for them to add more stuff and planets.

I am dreaming of shipping parts into orbit with several missions, assembling a interplanetary craft in Kermal orbit and launching to create a base on another planet.

-mh

Mostly harmless?

I think digital watches are a pretty neat idea.
